data.title: The Clermont London, Victoria
data.meta_description: Our historic Grade II listed hotel, near Victoria Station, has links to the Circle, District & Victoria underground lines. Book a stay in our Victoria hotel today!
data.text:
How do I get to my hotel after arriving at London's airports?

The Clermont hotels are situated in very convenient locations and can be easily reached via London's public transport. For information on London's Underground and other public transport options, please visit: https://tfl.gov.uk/plan-a-journey/

Gatwick Express — Gatwick to London Victoria 30 min

Heathrow Express — Heathrow to London Paddington 21 min

Thameslink – Luton to London St Pancras International 36 min

Can I arrange an airport transfer to my hotel?

Yes, we would be happy to help arrange an airport transfer for you - please email your hotel for details:

charingcross@theclermont.co.uk or victoria@theclermont.co.uk

What time am I able to check in?

If you have booked direct, you can check in at any time*; when it’s convenient for you.

Otherwise check in is from 3 pm. If you would like to arrange an earlier check-in time, let us know and we’ll do our best to arrange that, email stay@theclermont.co.uk

What time should I check out by?

Check out time is 11 am. If you fancy staying a little longer speak to the team at reception upon arrival or during your stay and we’ll do our best to arrange that.

If I arrive early will my room be ready?

We cannot guarantee your room will be ready if you arrive early, however, we can do all the pre-checking in paperwork and store your luggage for you.

*subject to availability

Do children stay free?

Children 12 years or younger can stay for free with an adult in existing bedding. Children aged 13 and over are charged as a 3rd person.

Do you provide cots or extra beds for children?

We provide cots free of charge and this can be arranged when making your booking, subject to availability.

Do you have family rooms at your hotels?

Yes, both Charing Cross and Victoria have family rooms or inter-connecting rooms with extra space for children.

Can children have their own room?

Children under 18 must be accompanied by an adult staying in the same room.

Do children eat for free?

Children 5 years of age, or younger, eat for free.

One child aged between 6 and 12 years of age may dine for free with each full-paying adult. Half portions will be provided. A charge of £8 will apply for each additional child.

Children 13 years or older are charged full price.
